trans-unit.source: Indicates that [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/add/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] could not read either the deployment or application manifests.
InvalidDeploymentException indicates the existence of a corrupt deployment or application manifest in a [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/add/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] application.
The error might occur because the manifests are poorly formed, have unrecognized elements for their schemas, or have mismatched digital signatures.
You are more likely to have corruption if you manually edit the deployment or application manifest files with a text editor.
You can usually correct this problem by regenerating your [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/add/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] deployment, which will create new deployment and application manifests.
For more detailed debugging steps, see the following links.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.InvalidDeploymentException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.InvalidDeploymentException"></xref> class with the specified message that describes the exception.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.InvalidDeploymentException"></xref> class.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.InvalidDeploymentException"></xref> class.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `innerException` parameter is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
